articles.author: Lisa Baertlein
articles.description: U.S. retailers and other delivery customers for the first time in more than four years are easily winning discounts from United Parcel Service and FedEx, according to industry data and interviews with seven professionals who advise shippers in price negotiations.
articles.title: UPS and FedEx customers regain upper hand in delivery price battle

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The number of instances of greenwashing by banks and financial services companies around the world rose 70% in the past 12 months from the previous 12 months, a report on Tuesday showed.
articles.title: Banks behind 70% jump in greenwashing incidents in 2023 -report

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Russian rouble weakened past the symbolic threshold of 100 to the dollar before recovering slightly in early trade on Tuesday, weighed down by foreign currency outflows and the country's shrinking current account surplus.
articles.title: Russian rouble weakens past 100 to the dollar

articles.author: John Kruzel
articles.description: The U.S. Supreme Court is set on Tuesday to hear a challenge to the funding structure of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB), a consumer watchdog established after the 2008 global financial crisis, in the first of several cases during its new term that could curb the power of federal agencies.
articles.title: US Supreme Court to hear case targeting consumer financial watchdog

articles.author: Supantha Mukherjee, Jyoti Narayan
articles.description: Meta Platforms (META.O) is exploring options to introduce ad-free subscription plans for Instagram and Facebook users in Europe, a person familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Meta explores options to charge EU users for ad-free subscriptions - source

articles.author: Maggie Fick
articles.description: The CEO of Novo Holdings, the controlling shareholder in drugmaker Novo Nordisk (NOVOb.CO), said on Tuesday he sees the window for initial public offerings (IPOs) opening within 18 months and is encouraging portfolio companies to get ready.
articles.title: Novo Nordisk owner sees chance to go public will open within 18 months

articles.author: Medha Singh, Lisa Mattackal
articles.description: Bitcoin? It's a bit old hat, say a cohort of crypto investors who are betting on blockchain technology breathing new life into traditional assets.
articles.title: Cryptoverse: 'It's a knife fight' as traders get tokenized

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: By Polina Nikolskaya and Maria Tsvetkova
articles.title: Insight: 'They're just meat': Russia deploys punishment battalions in echo of Stalin

articles.author: Jody Godoy, Luc Cohen
articles.description: Sam Bankman-Fried is set to go on trial on charges of stealing billions of dollars from customers of his FTX cryptocurrency exchange starting on Tuesday, nearly a year after the company's collapse shocked markets and tattered his reputation.
articles.title: Sam Bankman-Fried heads for trial on charges of stealing billions from FTX users

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A powerful faction of the Sinaloa cartel led by the sons of ex-Mexican drug lord Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman has banned fentanyl production and sales in Sinaloa, according to roadside banners, though analysts doubted the group would leave such a profitable business.
articles.title: El Chapo's sons ban fentanyl production in Sinaloa, according to banners
